poem:
Title: "On the Highlands' Keepsakes"

Highlands weave tartan tales in thistle sigh,
Scattered stones echo chants of reform denied.
Green titans joust, a rampant display,
Own half the heather where haggis play.
Fair Caledonia's twain lakes, their claims abide,
In stubborn misted prose, lands chide.
The weight of greed bends hardy acres
Under murky cloak of vested takers.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
